application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1 Oak tree in the rear garden, furthest away from the house - Remove the epicormic growth up to the first fork and remove deadwood.Remove the limb at the first fork, which is growing out to the right hand side, back to main trunk. T2 Oak tree in the rear garden, closer to the house - Remove the epicormic growth up to the first fork and remove deadwood.H1 Leylandii in the rear garden - Trim the top new growth to straighten the height line and trim back the side growth to tidy.H2 Laurel in the rear garden, along the right hand side boundary - Reduce in height down to a finished height of 3.5m. H3 Laurel in the rear garden, on the left hand side closest to the property - Trim back the side growth off the property, to give a 1m clearance. Reduce in height by 1m.Holly, Yew and privet overhanging from the neighbouring garden on the right hand side - Reduce the overhang from the neighbouring garden back to boundary.
